intro: Erigeron kopetdaghensis, commonly known as the Kopetdagh fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, specifically found in the Kopetdagh region of Turkmenistan and Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
